desc: px2q rectangular pool table, ball rolled at 45 degree eventually lands in corner pocket
problem:
\begin{problem*}{}{}
  A rectangular $p\times 2q$ pool table has pockets in every
  corner and in the middle of each $2q$-long side. A ball is
  rolled from a corner pocket at a $45^{\circ}$ angle with
  respect to the side rails. Find necessary and sufficient
  conditions on the real numbers $p$ and $q$ for the ball to
  eventually get into a pocket (angle of incidence is equal
  to the angle of reflection).
\end{problem*}
